p: Wild type Influenza A/equine/Jilin/1/89 (H3N8 JL89) and recombinant viruses were generated using a plasmid-based reverse genetics system as previously described [ 34, 35]. The generated wild-type virus and JL89-H52N-NP mutant virus were further propagated in 9-day-old embryonated chicken eggs at 35 °C for 72 hr, and allantoic fluid was harvested and centrifuged, and a hemagglutination test was performed to confirm the presence of the virus. Viruses from positive-testing samples were filtered through a 0.2 µm syringe filter (Millex, Merck, Ireland), and the viral titers were determined using the TCID 50 method of Reed and Muench [ 36]. Viruses were subsequently stored in small aliquots at −80 °C until further use.
